intro: Cyclobalanus philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine cyclobalan, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palm-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
